intro: Menodora jaliscana, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and distinctive, often palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. Menodora jaliscana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, shaded environments.
